DataElement.preferredName: Lymph Node Radiation Therapy Field Beam Arrangement Technique Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The technique used in the beam arrangement of the field for radiotherapy to lymph node(s).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lymph Node Radiation Therapy Radiation Field Beam Arrangement Technique
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._The spatial property of the way in which something is placed._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.:A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.:The spatial property of the way in which something is placed.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Concepts.definition: The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.
A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.
The spatial property of the way in which something is placed.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Denoting the front surface of the body; often used to indicate the position of one structure relative to another.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: Denoting the back surface of the body; at or near the hind end in quadrupeds or toward the spine in primates.
